casebody.data:
J. G. WHITE & CO., Inc., v. THOMAS, District Judge. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. March 7, 1916.)

Before COXE and ROGERS, Circuit Judges, and HOUGH, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

This court did not direct that a final judgment be entered; it simply directed that such proceedings be had in the District Court in accordance with the decision of this court “as according to right and justice and the laws of the United States ought to be had.” The petition is denied.
